title: Contest: Fan fiction (my thoughts of Pantheon) ive always wanted to be a baker

embed.description: This board is ONLY for fan fiction contest submissions, any other posts on this board will be deleted. Please see the stickied post for contest details.

body:
I actually didn't know {{champion:80}}  Pantheon was a champion that you could play {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}  until not long ago his new law came out. yes it was long and I couldn't be bothered to read it so i just skimmed through it, the second time I skimmed through it again i noticed that my story compared to what i was reading was a very big difference! so i would like to share this experience (this might as well be the new law lol ^^)

{{champion:80}} "Pantheon" The Artisan Of War.
In the days of war on Mount Targon, you could see the barbarians raising their blades towards you  from a distance coming closer and closer.
Until Pantheon gave the signal the Spartan's charged raising their spears and swords towards the hundreds of thousands of Barbarians.
the Spartans could kill easily 5 men by them selves but their was simply too much of them and they were getting overwhelmed by share power of numbers.

One by one his comrades fell to the ground. 
it was almost like if time slowed down, like a curse to make the victim see the things that was most important to him disappear.

Only two was left to face the rest of the thousand enemies.
And of course only one will survive.

as pantheon pulled out his spear from the last enemy, he looked back seeing his brother lying there on the snow
Pantheon buried him on the highest peak of all mountains in Mount Targon 
pantheon exchanged his helmet with his brothers one, his feelings and thoughts was all tangled and his heart can't understand why he exchanged his helmet with his brothers, but what i know is that he had a sense of guilt.

after a while standing there on the peak of mount targon with the sun slowly rising up, it reminded him of his childhood memories with his brother in the bakery their dad owned

he finally says "i guess ive always wanted to be a baker"

his guilt was that he couldn't save him and what he said was because he didn't want to fight anymore, killing and hating each other for more than 1000 years will never end. 

he simply don't want to see anymore of his comrades die in the battle field...

was this close enough to the official law? {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

replies.body: I actually really want to see a baker Pantheon skin. Rito please?
